attributes.action: Introduce a suspension on Council tax payments on empty homes
attributes.background: During these unprecedented times, and many landlords and letting agents unable to carry out viewing on vacant properties, due to government guidelines on movement. Local councils should exempt council tax payments for empty homes.

rejection.details:
It is up to individual local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons, to determine whether people responsible for a second or empty home are entitled to a council tax discount.

You could start a petition calling for the Governemnt to fund a council tax suspension for empty homes, or to require local authorities to make empty homes exempt from council tax, as these are actions the Government could take.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/
